Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2011 02:05PM scaredmommyof6 wrote: Sunshine9504 I'm in the same boat as you. I'm going in for a ultrasound guided needle biopsy tomorrow.  I have a lump, measured on ultrasound to be just about 1cm. Now my mind is going a mile a minute, I'm in google overdrive. Super scared for the patholgy results to be bad.  Now every little ache and pain I have is making me question my overall health. I'm sure I'm worrying myself more then I need to but the unknown is the worst. At least if I knew for sure what it was then I could have a plan in order on how to deal with it.  Good luck at your biopsy tomorrow I'll be thinking of you and praying that we both hear good results.  My biopsy is scheduled for 9am.
Posts.Title: Biopsy Sunshine9504 Sunshine9504

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2011 12:22PM scaredmommyof6 wrote: I'm worried and scared too. I'm a 34 yr old mother of 6.  My husband found a lump in my breast on Wednesday the 27th, that day I got in with my obgyn she ordered a bilateral mammogram and ultrasound for Friday the 29th.  The radiologist said she was "unsure" of what it is so I'm scheduled for a needle biopsy tomorrow morning.  I too have been googling like crazy, and inturn turning myself into a basket case.  The "thing" they measured is just over 1cm.  In November when I was 5 months pregnant I had a lump in the same breast and they did a ultrasound and said it was a clogged milk duct....now here we are 8 months later in the same spot with this "lump".  I dont know if it went away to be honest I wasnt really paying attention once they told me it was a clogged milk duct I figured it didnt need anymore attention or thought.  I'm scared of the unknown, scared of the what ifs......just scared
Posts.Title: Worried Sick can't stop the google worriedsick33 Wicked

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2011 01:05PM scaredmommyof6 wrote: Thanks ladies. Home from the biopsy, they did fine needle and core biopsy. They said this is the only spot that shows concern from the mammogram and ultrasound. Now the waiting begins for the phone call. They said I should have the results by Friday.  I have an appt scheduled with the Breast Surgeon for Tuesday 8:30am....the dr said they like to have the appts made one way or another before the results are in. Continueing to hope for B9 results.  Thanks again for all of your support!
Posts.Title: scared and worried like never before... scaredmommyof6 SarahsMom

Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2011 07:19AM scaredmommyof6 wrote: Praying for B9 results!!! Try to think only good things!! If it is what we never want to hear, know it's a battle that can be fought and WON.  I encourage you to look at the forum under Biographies and Success Stories, with the Topic Success Stories. When I was waiting for my results I found that forum so inspirational because you see that this is a war that can be won and there are so many stories of women going on to live 20, 30, 40 years after diagnosis.  But remember you do not have a diagnosis yet, so it could still be nothing. Praying for you, your babies, and the stregnth you need to get through this difficult time.
Posts.Title: More aspects to worry about...appointment today. merrysee bella76

Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2011 04:09PM scaredmommyof6 wrote: Once again I can't thank you enough for your words of encouragement and support.  I have taken some xanex, my husband thinks I should take it more regularly and perhaps 2 pills as the dr said I could if I really needed it.  I find that it makes me so tired and with 6 little ones I can't be sleeping.  I did find another forum on here with "Success Stories" and I have to tell you it was uplifting.  I still hope for B9 results of course but reading their stories made me realize that this is a battle that if it has to be fought can be won.  Praying for each and everyone of you!!  And AmyisStrong we are only about 30 mins away from each other. I live in Nottingham PA. What a "small" world
Posts.Title: scared and worried like never before... scaredmommyof6 SarahsMom

Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2017 08:24AM Scaredmommy1971723 wrote: First words I heard "All good news". I never thought I'd hear good news again. Clinical staging is Stage II. I meet with radiation oncologist Dec 5 and surgery scheduled for Jan 2. CLINICAL HISTORY: Biopsy-proven left breast carcinoma COMPARISON: Sonogram and mammogram dated 11/2/2017 FINDINGS: Right Breast: There is mild benign background breast parenchymal enhancement. There are no areas of suspicious enhancement or lymphadenopathy. Left Breast: There is mild benign background breast parenchymal enhancement. There is a 2 x 1.5 x 2.5 cm irregular only marginated spiculated avidly enhancing mass in the 12:00 axis of the left breast likely 3.5 cm in the nipple with associated postbiopsy changes. This corresponds to the biopsy-proven breast carcinoma seen on recent sonogram and mammogram no suspicious adenopathy is seen. No chest wall or nipple invasion is noted. No multifocal disease is noted. Diffusion images are relatively unremarkable.
Posts.Title: MRI results today Scaredmommy1971723 Scaredmommy1971723

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2011 06:35AM scaredmommyof6 wrote: Thank you all for your positive thoughts, prayers, and encouraging words.  We are leaving in about 30 mins to head to the hospital.  Praying for B9 results.  So happy I found this site, praying for all members those still waiting like me, those still fighting the battle, and those that are surviviors.
Posts.Title: scared and worried like never before... scaredmommyof6 SarahsMom

Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2011 09:11PM scaredmommyof6 wrote: Got my call at 5:29pm tonight the results are BENIGN!!! Pathology shows an infection or absess of some sort. Still meeting with the breast surgeon Tuesday morning to see about removing it. So thankful for my results, but more thankful that this week has taught me a understanding of the "fear" of cancer, "the battle" of cancer, and the "triumph" of survivial. This website is a godsend, to those in each stage....fear, battle, and triumph. God Bless each and every one of you and your families. I feel like I do have a "fight" to be fought, and that is to do my part to Fight this disease for anyone diagnosed. I can't wait to get involved in fighting for a cure. So thank you for your support, your words of encouragement, your words of comfort.  Thank you for doing what women do best....loving one another.  Many hugs!!!
Posts.Title: scared and worried like never before... scaredmommyof6 SarahsMom
